column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=The polycrystalline powders of quadruple perovskite oxide CaCu3Ru4O12 were prepared by a conventional solid-state reaction.
#Text=Stoichiometric mixtures of 0.2002 g CaCO3, 0.4773 g CuO, and 1.0645 g RuO2 were thoroughly ground and sintered in static and ambient air at 1000 °C for 24 h.
#Text=Then, the obtained powders were reground and calcined in static and ambient air at 1000 °C for 24 h to produce the sample.
#Text=All the products were furnace-cooled to room temperature and ground by hand.
#Text=The powder XRD patterns were collected on a Rigaku TTR-III diffractometer equipped with a Cu Kα radiation source (λ = 1.5418 Å).
#Text=The SEM images were obtained on the field emission scanning electron microscope (JEOL-2010 SEM) operated at 5 kV.
#Text=The SEM specimens were prepared by depositing the catalyst powders on conductive carbon adhesive tape.
#Text=HRTEM images and SAED patterns were acquired using a transmission electron microscope (JEOL, JEM-ARM200F) with a spherical aberration corrector at an acceleration voltage of 200 kV.

#Text=For TEM specimen preparation, the catalyst powders were firstly dispersed in ethanol by sonication and then dropped onto a carbon-coated molybdenum grid with micropipettes, followed by drying under ambient conditions.
#Text=XPS were carried out on an ESCALAB 250 X -ray photoelectron spectrometer using an Al Kα X-ray source.
#Text=For XPS analysis, the binding energies were calibrated by referencing the C 1 s peak to 284.8 eV and no background subtraction was performed.
#Text=The nitrogen adsorption-desorption isotherms were recorded at 77 K according to the preset pressure procedure using a Micromeritics ASAP 2000 system.
#Text=Prior to the measurements, the samples were outgassed at 300 °C under vacuum for 10 h.
#Text=The total surface areas were deduced from the isotherm analysis over the range of the relative pressure from 0.05 to 0.20.
#Text=ICP-AES was performed on a Perkin-Elmer Optima 3300DV ICP spectrometer.
#Text=The temperature-dependent resistivities of pelleted samples were measured on a Quantum Design Physical Property Measurement System by using the four-probe method.

#Text=O K-edge XAS were measured at the beamline BL12B of National Synchrotron Radiation Laboratory (NSRL, Hefei) in the total electron yield mode by collecting the sample drain current under a vacuum better than 10−7 Pa.
#Text=The beam from the bending magnet was monochromatized by utilizing a varied line-spacing plane grating and refocused by a toroidal mirror.
#Text=The spectra from 525 to 550 eV were scanned with an energy resolution of 0.2 eV.

#Text=To eliminate the effect of different sample concentration and measurement conditions on the intensity of XAS peaks, all the spectra were normalized to the adsorption background at the energy ranges both below the absorption edge and at ∼550 eV as described in the literatures27,28,31.
#Text=The XAS specimens were prepared by placing a small amount of catalyst powders on a conductive carbon tape, which was mounted on an aluminum holder attached to the main chamber manipulator.
